intro: Hebanthe erianthos f. ovatifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed hebanthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its ovate, hairy leaves that are often clustered at the base of the plant. The species produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. This plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
